sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4} be two sets. Find the sets (A x B) △ B and A x (B △ A), where △ represents the symmetric difference operator. Show that (A x B) △ B is not equal to A x (B △ A), thereby proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
